cipher_hc3245 package¶

Submodules¶

cipher_hc3245.cipher_hc3245 module¶

cipher_hc3245.cipher_hc3245.cipher(text, shift, encrypt=True)[source]¶

1. Description: The Caesar cipher is one of the simplest and most widely known encryption techniques. In short, each letter is replaced by a letter some fixed number of positions down the alphabet. Apparently, Julius Caesar used it in his private correspondence. 2. Explanation: The first input is a string that you want to decipher The second input is the amount of shift for each letters in that string The output will be the outcome of the orginal string after a certain shifting. 3. Example: If you put “gdkkn” and 1 in the cipher function like this: cipher(“gdkkn”, 1), you will get “hello”
